alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 3:15PM PDT until July 03 at 4:15PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Muckamuck burn scar in Okanogan County in north central Washington. * WHEN...Until 515 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 313 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conconully, Alder Campground and Salmon Meadows Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain may trigger rockslides, mudslides, and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
